div.head: To the courteous and indifferent Reader, especially to all such who 〈◊〉 troubled with any disease incident to the eyes.
div.p:
I Haue not here (courteous and indifferent Reader) entertained thee with fine phrases, and artificiall method (things curious and becomming the curious) I leaue that to those which are more ambitious of priuate fame, then studious for the common good. But I haue truly and plainely shewed thee how to beware of, and preuent certaine grieuous inconueniences: where the disease is curable, I haue set downe approued remedies for it, where it is incurable, I aduise thee to comfort
thy selfe in God, and saue thy money: Reade and practise, and as thou findest any profit, take in good part my paines, but giue the whole praise vnto God, to whose holy protection I commit thee and my selfe, and all the faithfull in Christ Iesus. Farewell.
